sentences.sContent: Young prisoners are being corrupted by the older, long-term offenders.
sentences.sCn: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.sContent: Corrupt judges have taken millions of dollars in bribes.
sentences.sCn: 腐败的法官接受了几百万美元的贿赂。

sentences.sContent: ...Assuming that your teacher is neither biased nor corrupt and that her system conforms to school rules...

remMethod.val: cor ＋ rupt(断裂) → 完全断裂 → 堕落的， 腐败的

words.tran: 易腐败的；易堕落的；可以贿赂的
使堕落的；腐败性的；使腐坏的
堕落性；腐败性；易腐败的倾向

trans.tranOther: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way
using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself
